metadata.description: Traditional Peranakan (Straits Chinese) dishes, blending Chinese cooking techniques with Malay spices and ingredients

recipes.name: Ayam Buah Keluak
recipes.description: Classic Peranakan chicken stew with earthy buah keluak nuts, pork, and aromatic spices.
steps: Blend spice paste ingredients until smooth. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add chicken and pork, brown lightly.
Add buah keluak flesh, tamarind juice, and water. Simmer 1.5–2 hours until meat is tender.
Season to taste and serve with rice.
tips: Soak buah keluak overnight and scrub thoroughly.
Adjust tamarind for desired tanginess.
recipes.source: https://www.noobcook.com/ayam-buah-keluak/
recipes.origin: Ayam Buah Keluak is a signature Peranakan dish, blending Malay and Chinese influences.

recipes.name: Babi Pong Tay
recipes.description: Peranakan braised pork belly with fermented bean paste, mushrooms, and potatoes.
steps: Blend shallots and garlic, fry in oil until fragrant.
Add pork belly, brown lightly, then add bean paste, soy sauce, and sugar.
Add mushrooms, potatoes, and water. Simmer 1.5 hours until pork is tender and sauce is thick.
Serve with steamed rice.
tips: Use pork belly with skin for best texture.
Let stew rest overnight for deeper flavor.
recipes.source: https://www.noobcook.com/babi-pong-tay/
recipes.origin: Babi Pong Tay is a classic Peranakan comfort food, often served at family gatherings.

recipes.name: Kueh Pie Tee
recipes.description: Crispy pastry cups filled with braised turnip, carrots, and prawns, topped with chili and coriander, a Peranakan party favorite.
steps: Mix shell ingredients to form a thin batter. Dip pie tee mould in hot oil, then in batter, and fry until crisp. Drain and cool.
Fry garlic, shallots, and dried shrimp. Add turnip, carrot, prawns, soy sauce, and sugar. Cook until soft and dry.
Fill shells with turnip mixture, top with coriander and chili sauce. Serve immediately.
tips: Make shells ahead and store airtight.
Fill just before serving to keep shells crisp.
recipes.source: https://www.noobcook.com/kueh-pie-tee/
recipes.origin: Kueh Pie Tee is a Peranakan party snack, popular at festive gatherings.

recipes.name: Perut Ikan
recipes.description: Peranakan spicy and tangy curry of pickled fish stomach, vegetables, and aromatic herbs.
steps: Blend rempah ingredients. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add pickled fish stomach, vegetables, pineapple, and tamarind juice. Simmer 20 minutes.
Add coconut milk and herbs. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve hot.
tips: Use fresh herbs for authentic flavor.
Adjust tamarind for desired tanginess.
recipes.source: https://www.noobcook.com/perut-ikan/
recipes.origin: A Peranakan specialty, found at Nyonya restaurants and festive occasions.

ingredient_breakdown.ingredient: pickled fish stomach (perut ikan) or mackerel

recipes.name: Kerabu Bee Hoon
recipes.description: Peranakan cold rice vermicelli salad with herbs, prawns, and a tangy spicy dressing.
steps: Mix dressing ingredients until sugar dissolves.
Toss bee hoon, prawns, vegetables, and herbs with dressing.
Garnish with fried shallots. Serve chilled.
tips: Use fresh herbs for best flavor.
Serve immediately for best texture.
recipes.source: https://www.noobcook.com/kerabu-bee-hoon/
recipes.origin: A Peranakan salad, popular at festive gatherings and potlucks.

recipes.name: Semur (Peranakan Beef Stew)
recipes.description: A rich, aromatic Peranakan stew of beef braised with sweet soy sauce, potatoes, tomatoes, and spices. Sweet, savory, and deeply comforting.
preparation: Heat oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add beef and brown on all sides. Add spices, soy sauces, sugar, and water. Bring to a boil, skim scum.
Add potatoes and tomatoes. Simmer 2 hours until beef is tender and sauce is rich.
Season with black pepper. Serve hot with rice.
tips: Use brisket or shin for best texture.
Add carrots or hard-boiled eggs for variation.
recipes.source: Adapted from Nyonya Cooking, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Heat oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add beef and brown on all sides. Add spices, soy sauces, sugar, and water. Bring to a boil, skim scum.
Add potatoes and tomatoes. Simmer 2 hours until beef is tender and sauce is rich.
Season with black pepper. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Putugal (Steamed Tapioca Banana Kueh)
recipes.description: A traditional Eurasian and Peranakan steamed kueh made with tapioca, banana, and coconut, colored blue with butterfly pea flower. Soft, chewy, and lightly sweet.
preparation: Mix grated tapioca, sugar, salt, coconut milk, and butterfly pea water (if using) to form a thick batter.
Line a steaming tray with banana leaf. Spread half the batter, layer with banana slices, then cover with remaining batter.
Steam 30 minutes until set. Cool, cut into pieces, and coat with grated coconut.
tips: Use ripe bananas for best flavor.
Add a pinch of salt to the coconut for extra taste.
recipes.source: Adapted from Eurasian and Peranakan home kitchens, Nyonya Cooking.
steps: Mix grated tapioca, sugar, salt, coconut milk, and butterfly pea water (if using) to form a thick batter.
Line a steaming tray with banana leaf. Spread half the batter, layer with banana slices, then cover with remaining batter.
Steam 30 minutes until set. Cool, cut into pieces, and coat with grated coconut.

recipes.name: Lor Kai Yik (Braised Chicken and Tofu in Red Fermented Bean Curd)
recipes.description: A unique Hokkien-Peranakan dish: chicken, tofu, and vegetables braised in a savory-sweet sauce with red fermented bean curd, garlic, and five spice. Rich, tangy, and deeply flavorful.
preparation: Heat oil in a pot. Sauté garlic and bean curd until fragrant.
Add chicken, daikon, five spice, sugar, soy sauces, and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer 45–60 minutes until chicken and daikon are tender and sauce is rich.
Add tofu, simmer 10 more minutes. Serve hot with rice.
tips: Use pork belly for variation.
Add hard-boiled eggs for extra richness.
recipes.source: Adapted from Nyonya Cooking, The MeatMen, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Heat oil in a pot. Sauté garlic and bean curd until fragrant.
Add chicken, daikon, five spice, sugar, soy sauces, and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer 45–60 minutes until chicken and daikon are tender and sauce is rich.
Add tofu, simmer 10 more minutes. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Ngoh Hiang (Five-Spice Meat Rolls)
recipes.description: A classic Peranakan and Teochew dish: minced pork, prawn, and water chestnut seasoned with five spice, wrapped in beancurd skin and deep-fried. Served with sweet sauce and chili.
preparation: Mix all filling ingredients. Spread on beancurd skin, roll up and seal.
Steam 15 minutes, then deep-fry until golden. Slice and serve with sweet sauce and chili.
tips: Chill rolls before frying for easier slicing.
Add yam for extra texture.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Mix all filling ingredients. Spread on beancurd skin, roll up and seal.
Steam 15 minutes, then deep-fry until golden. Slice and serve with sweet sauce and chili.

recipes.name: Hae Cho (Prawn Rolls)
recipes.description: A Teochew and Peranakan favorite: prawn and pork rolls seasoned with five spice, wrapped in beancurd skin and deep-fried. Served at festive occasions and as a snack.
preparation: Mix all filling ingredients. Spread on beancurd skin, roll up and seal.
Steam 10 minutes, then deep-fry until golden. Slice and serve.
tips: Add yam for extra texture.
Serve with sweet sauce or chili.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Teochew kitchens.
steps: Mix all filling ingredients. Spread on beancurd skin, roll up and seal.
Steam 10 minutes, then deep-fry until golden. Slice and serve.

recipes.name: Peng Kueh (Pink Rice Dumplings)
recipes.description: A Teochew and Peranakan snack: pink steamed dumplings filled with glutinous rice, mushrooms, peanuts, and dried shrimp. Served at breakfast and snack stalls.
preparation: Fry shallots, mushrooms, and shrimp. Add rice, peanuts, and salt. Cook until fragrant.
Mix rice flour, hot water, and coloring to form a dough. Roll out, fill with rice mixture, shape in molds.
Steam 15–20 minutes until cooked. Serve warm.
tips: Use special peng kueh molds for authentic shape.
Serve with sweet soy sauce.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Teochew kitchens.
steps: Fry shallots, mushrooms, and shrimp. Add rice, peanuts, and salt. Cook until fragrant.
Mix rice flour, hot water, and coloring to form a dough. Roll out, fill with rice mixture, shape in molds.
Steam 15–20 minutes until cooked. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Soon Kueh (Bamboo Shoot Dumplings)
recipes.description: A Teochew and Peranakan snack: steamed dumplings filled with bamboo shoots, jicama, and dried shrimp. Served at breakfast and snack stalls.
preparation: Fry shallots, shrimp, bamboo, jicama, and carrot. Season with salt.
Mix flours and hot water to form a dough. Roll out, fill with vegetable mixture, shape in molds.
Steam 10–12 minutes until translucent. Serve warm.
tips: Use special soon kueh molds for authentic shape.
Serve with sweet soy sauce and chili.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Teochew kitchens.
steps: Fry shallots, shrimp, bamboo, jicama, and carrot. Season with salt.
Mix flours and hot water to form a dough. Roll out, fill with vegetable mixture, shape in molds.
Steam 10–12 minutes until translucent. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Inchi Kabin (Nyonya Fried Chicken)
recipes.description: A Penang Nyonya specialty: spiced fried chicken marinated with coconut milk, five spice, and aromatics. Crispy, juicy, and fragrant.
preparation: Mix all marinade ingredients. Coat chicken, marinate at least 4 hours or overnight.
Heat oil, fry chicken until golden and cooked through. Drain and serve hot.
tips: Marinate overnight for best flavor.
Serve with Worcestershire sauce dip.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Penang Nyonya kitchens.
steps: Mix all marinade ingredients. Coat chicken, marinate at least 4 hours or overnight.
Heat oil, fry chicken until golden and cooked through. Drain and serve hot.

recipes.name: Bak Chang (Nyonya Rice Dumplings)
recipes.description: A festive Peranakan dumpling: glutinous rice filled with pork, candied winter melon, mushrooms, and spices, wrapped in bamboo leaves and boiled. Distinctive blue from butterfly pea flower.
preparation: Fry shallots, garlic, pork, mushrooms, shrimp, and winter melon. Season with spices, soy, sugar, and salt.
Divide rice, color half with blue pea water. Layer white and blue rice, add filling, wrap in bamboo leaves, tie securely.
Boil 2 hours until tender. Serve warm.
tips: Use blue pea flower for authentic color.
Serve with sweet chili sauce.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Penang Nyonya kitchens.
steps: Fry shallots, garlic, pork, mushrooms, shrimp, and winter melon. Season with spices, soy, sugar, and salt.
Divide rice, color half with blue pea water. Layer white and blue rice, add filling, wrap in bamboo leaves, tie securely.
Boil 2 hours until tender. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Babi Assam (Tamarind Pork)
recipes.description: A tangy, aromatic Peranakan stew: pork belly braised with tamarind, chilies, and spices. Served with rice at Nyonya homes.
preparation: Blend chilies, shallots, garlic, ginger, and belacan. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add pork, brown lightly. Add tamarind water, sugar, and salt. Simmer 1 hour until pork is tender and sauce is thick.
tips: Use pork shoulder for a leaner version.
Add pineapple for extra tang.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Blend chilies, shallots, garlic, ginger, and belacan. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add pork, brown lightly. Add tamarind water, sugar, and salt. Simmer 1 hour until pork is tender and sauce is thick.

recipes.name: Itek Tim (Salted Vegetable Duck Soup)
recipes.description: A classic Peranakan soup: duck simmered with salted vegetables, tomatoes, and sour plums. Tangy, savory, and comforting.
preparation: Blanch duck pieces, drain. Add all ingredients to a large pot, bring to a boil, simmer 2 hours until duck is tender and soup is flavorful.
tips: Use old duck for richer broth.
Add more sour plums for extra tang.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Blanch duck pieces, drain. Add all ingredients to a large pot, bring to a boil, simmer 2 hours until duck is tender and soup is flavorful.

recipes.name: Seh Bak (Nyonya Braised Pork Belly)
recipes.description: A Penang Nyonya favorite: pork belly braised with five spice, garlic, and soy sauce. Rich, savory, and melt-in-your-mouth.
preparation: Fry garlic and five spice in oil. Add pork, brown lightly. Add soy sauces, sugar, and water. Simmer 2 hours until pork is tender and sauce is rich.
tips: Let stew rest overnight for deeper flavor.
Serve with steamed buns or rice.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Penang Nyonya kitchens.
steps: Fry garlic and five spice in oil. Add pork, brown lightly. Add soy sauces, sugar, and water. Simmer 2 hours until pork is tender and sauce is rich.

recipes.name: Swikee (Frog Leg Soup)
recipes.description: A Peranakan and Indonesian specialty: frog legs simmered in a ginger-garlic broth with Chinese celery and white pepper. Delicate, savory, and warming.
preparation: Blanch frog legs, drain. Add all ingredients to a pot, bring to a boil, simmer 1 hour. Season to taste and serve hot.
tips: Add more ginger for extra warmth.
Serve with steamed rice.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Blanch frog legs, drain. Add all ingredients to a pot, bring to a boil, simmer 1 hour. Season to taste and serve hot.

recipes.name: Kueh Salat (Kuih Seri Muka)
recipes.description: A classic Peranakan kueh: two layers of glutinous rice and pandan custard, rich, fragrant, and colorful. Served at festive occasions and kueh stalls.
preparation: Steam glutinous rice with half the coconut milk and salt. Press into a lined pan.
Mix eggs, sugar, flour, cornstarch, pandan juice, and remaining coconut milk. Pour over rice, steam 40 minutes until set. Cool, cut into squares.
tips: Use fresh pandan juice for best aroma.
Chill before cutting for clean layers.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore kueh stalls.
steps: Steam glutinous rice with half the coconut milk and salt. Press into a lined pan.
Mix eggs, sugar, flour, cornstarch, pandan juice, and remaining coconut milk. Pour over rice, steam 40 minutes until set. Cool, cut into squares.

recipes.name: Kari Kapitan (Nyonya Chicken Curry)
recipes.description: A rich, aromatic Peranakan chicken curry with coconut milk, candlenuts, and spices. Served with rice or bread at Nyonya homes.
preparation: Blend shallots, garlic, ginger, lemongrass, chilies, turmeric, galangal, candlenuts, and belacan. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add chicken, brown lightly. Add coconut milk, potatoes, salt, and sugar. Simmer 1 hour until chicken is tender and sauce is thick.
tips: Use kampung chicken for best texture.
Serve with steamed rice or bread.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Blend shallots, garlic, ginger, lemongrass, chilies, turmeric, galangal, candlenuts, and belacan. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add chicken, brown lightly. Add coconut milk, potatoes, salt, and sugar. Simmer 1 hour until chicken is tender and sauce is thick.

recipes.name: Nyonya Stewed Pork Ribs
recipes.description: A comforting Peranakan stew: pork ribs braised with soy sauce, garlic, and spices. Tender, savory, and perfect with rice.
preparation: Fry garlic and five spice in oil. Add pork ribs, brown lightly. Add soy sauces, sugar, and water. Simmer 1.5 hours until ribs are tender and sauce is rich.
tips: Let stew rest overnight for deeper flavor.
Serve with steamed rice.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Fry garlic and five spice in oil. Add pork ribs, brown lightly. Add soy sauces, sugar, and water. Simmer 1.5 hours until ribs are tender and sauce is rich.

recipes.name: Asam Prawn (Tamarind Prawns)
recipes.description: A tangy, savory Peranakan dish: prawns marinated in tamarind and sugar, pan-fried until caramelized. Served with rice at Nyonya homes.
preparation: Marinate prawns in tamarind water, sugar, and salt 15 minutes. Heat oil, fry prawns until caramelized and cooked through. Serve hot.
tips: Use large, fresh prawns for best flavor.
Do not overcook prawns.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Marinate prawns in tamarind water, sugar, and salt 15 minutes. Heat oil, fry prawns until caramelized and cooked through. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Lor Bak (Nyonya Braised Pork)
recipes.description: A Penang Nyonya classic: pork belly braised with five spice, soy sauce, and garlic. Rich, savory, and melt-in-your-mouth.
preparation: Fry garlic and five spice in oil. Add pork, brown lightly. Add soy sauces, sugar, and water. Simmer 2 hours until pork is tender and sauce is rich.
tips: Let stew rest overnight for deeper flavor.
Serve with steamed buns or rice.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Penang Nyonya kitchens.
steps: Fry garlic and five spice in oil. Add pork, brown lightly. Add soy sauces, sugar, and water. Simmer 2 hours until pork is tender and sauce is rich.

recipes.name: Kueh Dadar (Pandan Coconut Crepes)
recipes.description: A Peranakan and Malay kueh: pandan crepes filled with sweet coconut and palm sugar. Soft, fragrant, and colorful. Served at kueh stalls and festive occasions.
preparation: Mix flour, eggs, pandan juice, coconut milk, and salt to form a batter. Cook thin crepes in a pan.
Melt palm sugar with a little water, add coconut and salt. Cook until thick. Fill crepes with coconut mixture, roll up. Serve at room temperature.
tips: Use fresh pandan juice for best aroma.
Serve on banana leaves for presentation.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore kueh stalls.
steps: Mix flour, eggs, pandan juice, coconut milk, and salt to form a batter. Cook thin crepes in a pan.
Melt palm sugar with a little water, add coconut and salt. Cook until thick. Fill crepes with coconut mixture, roll up. Serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Kueh Talam (Pandan Coconut Layer Cake)
recipes.description: A Peranakan kueh: two layers of pandan and coconut, steamed until set. Soft, fragrant, and colorful. Served at kueh stalls and festive occasions.
preparation: Mix flours, sugar, pandan juice, and half the coconut milk for the green layer. Pour into a lined pan, steam 20 minutes.
Mix remaining coconut milk and salt for the white layer. Pour over green layer, steam 20 minutes until set. Cool, cut into squares.
tips: Use fresh pandan juice for best aroma.
Chill before cutting for clean layers.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore kueh stalls.
steps: Mix flours, sugar, pandan juice, and half the coconut milk for the green layer. Pour into a lined pan, steam 20 minutes.
Mix remaining coconut milk and salt for the white layer. Pour over green layer, steam 20 minutes until set. Cool, cut into squares.

recipes.name: Udang Masak Nanas (Pineapple Prawn Curry)
recipes.description: A tangy, aromatic Peranakan curry: prawns and pineapple simmered in a spicy coconut gravy. Served with rice at Nyonya homes.
preparation: Blend rempah ingredients. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add pineapple, fry 2 minutes. Add coconut milk, tamarind, salt, and sugar. Simmer 10 minutes.
Add prawns, cook until just done. Serve hot with rice.
tips: Do not overcook prawns.
Add more chilies for extra heat.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Blend rempah ingredients. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add pineapple, fry 2 minutes. Add coconut milk, tamarind, salt, and sugar. Simmer 10 minutes.
Add prawns, cook until just done. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Belimbing Masak Lemak (Starfruit in Coconut Gravy)
recipes.description: A unique Peranakan and Malay dish: starfruit (belimbing) cooked in a spicy, creamy coconut gravy with dried shrimp and turmeric. Served with rice.
preparation: Blend rempah ingredients. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add dried shrimp, fry 2 minutes. Add coconut milk, belimbing, salt, and sugar. Simmer 15 minutes until belimbing is tender. Serve hot.
tips: Use young, sour starfruit for best flavor.
Add prawns for a heartier dish.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Blend rempah ingredients. Fry in oil until fragrant.
Add dried shrimp, fry 2 minutes. Add coconut milk, belimbing, salt, and sugar. Simmer 15 minutes until belimbing is tender. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Kiam Chye Buey (Peranakan Mustard Green Stew)
recipes.description: A tangy, savory stew of leftover roast meats, salted mustard greens, tomatoes, and tamarind. Served at Peranakan homes after festive feasts.
preparation: Blanch salted mustard greens. Add all ingredients to a large pot, bring to a boil, simmer 2 hours until flavors meld. Serve hot.
tips: Use a mix of meats for best flavor.
Add more tamarind for extra tang.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Blanch salted mustard greens. Add all ingredients to a large pot, bring to a boil, simmer 2 hours until flavors meld. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Bakwan Kepiting (Crabmeat Meatball Soup)
recipes.description: A festive Peranakan soup: pork and crabmeat balls simmered in a clear broth with bamboo shoots and vegetables. Served at celebrations and family gatherings.
preparation: Mix crabmeat, pork, prawns, egg, cornstarch, salt, and pepper. Shape into balls.
Bring stock to a boil, add meatballs, bamboo, and carrot. Simmer 30 minutes. Garnish with spring onions. Serve hot.
tips: Use fresh crabmeat for best flavor.
Add glass noodles for variation.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Mix crabmeat, pork, prawns, egg, cornstarch, salt, and pepper. Shape into balls.
Bring stock to a boil, add meatballs, bamboo, and carrot. Simmer 30 minutes. Garnish with spring onions. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Nasi Ulam (Herbed Rice Salad)
recipes.description: A refreshing Peranakan salad: rice tossed with a medley of fresh herbs, dried shrimp, and toasted coconut. Served at festive occasions and potlucks.
preparation: Toss all ingredients together in a large bowl. Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve at room temperature.
tips: Use a variety of fresh herbs for best flavor.
Add fried fish for a heartier salad.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Toss all ingredients together in a large bowl. Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve at room temperature.

ingredient_breakdown.ingredient: fresh herbs (daun kaduk, mint, laksa leaves, etc.)

recipes.name: Pineapple Fried Rice (Nasi Goreng Nanas)
recipes.description: A festive Peranakan and Thai-inspired fried rice: rice stir-fried with pineapple, prawns, cashews, and spices. Served in a pineapple shell at parties.
preparation: Heat oil, fry garlic and shallots. Add egg, scramble. Add prawns, pineapple, and rice. Stir in curry powder, soy, and fish sauce. Toss with cashews and spring onions. Serve hot.
tips: Use day-old rice for best texture.
Serve in a hollowed pineapple for presentation.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Heat oil, fry garlic and shallots. Add egg, scramble. Add prawns, pineapple, and rice. Stir in curry powder, soy, and fish sauce. Toss with cashews and spring onions. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Buah Papaya Masak Titek (Peppery Papaya Soup)
recipes.description: A classic Eurasian and Peranakan soup: green papaya simmered with pork ribs, white pepper, and garlic. Peppery, savory, and comforting.
preparation: Blanch pork ribs, drain. Add all ingredients to a pot, bring to a boil, simmer 1 hour until papaya is tender and soup is peppery. Serve hot.
tips: Use green, unripe papaya for best texture.
Add more pepper for extra heat.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore Eurasian/Peranakan kitchens.
steps: Blanch pork ribs, drain. Add all ingredients to a pot, bring to a boil, simmer 1 hour until papaya is tender and soup is peppery. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Kuih Bongkong (Steamed Coconut Pudding)
recipes.description: A traditional Peranakan and Malay kueh: steamed coconut pudding with gula melaka, wrapped in banana leaves. Soft, fragrant, and lightly sweet.
preparation: Mix flours, coconut milk, and salt. Pour a little batter onto banana leaf, add gula melaka, cover with more batter. Wrap and fold. Steam 30–40 minutes until set. Serve warm or at room temperature.
tips: Use fresh banana leaves for best aroma.
Add pandan juice for extra fragrance.
recipes.source: Adapted from The MeatMen, Rasa Malaysia, and Singapore kueh stalls.
steps: Mix flours, coconut milk, and salt. Pour a little batter onto banana leaf, add gula melaka, cover with more batter. Wrap and fold. Steam 30–40 minutes until set. Serve warm or at room temperature.
